title: aoluain
author: aoluain
content: I am currently running a community project centered around 1 Bitcoin themed Colouring Book.Original thread > https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5409493.0The Book has been to 3 continents and is currently nearing the end of its journey in the United StatesDue to one participant not being able to take part there is now 1 spot open for anyone based in the U.S.Its FREE to enter, your only cost will be postage to the nest participant after you do your art.!! Postage must be by registered mail !!There are 10 FREE tickets - the Bitcoin blockchain will pick the winning ticket

comments.author: aoluain
comments.created_time: October 05, 2023, 08:17:14 PMLast edit: October 07, 2023, 06:54:36 AM by aoluain

comments.author: geophphreigh
comments.body: I expressed interest in this in the original thread. I would love to have a free ticket for a chance to participate. Geophphreigh

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: geophphreigh on October 05, 2023, 08:48:59 PMI expressed interest in this in the original thread. I would love to have a free ticket for a chance to participate. GeophphreighDamn I missed that @Geo... Personally, I think you should just get the spot myself, 1. being the first to respond, and 2. Having known you so long here and you are one of the best & trustworthy peoples I've met here! No offense @Alouain, I just think the faster we fill the better. Edit - I guess then again, changing the terms of the raffle might be considered a bad move, but let's see what replies materialize now...

comments.author: geophphreigh
comments.body: I appreciate the kind words owlcatz, but not looking to hijack the raffle. I am more than happy to throw my hat in the ring with any others interested and let the blockchain decide. Geophphreigh

comments.author: aoluain
comments.body: Ok so since I havent specified a closing date or that all 10 tickets be filled I think I canaward the position to geo based on the fact that geo is the only one who is interestedand that geo posted interest in the original thread but was too late.Quote from: geophphreigh on November 11, 2022, 01:09:07 PMNot sure if still needed, but happy to participate if necessary. Looks like a fun project, not sure how I missed it originally? LMK. GeoAlso owlcatz recommendation carries some weight for me ! and we do need to fill theposition quickly.So as of now geophphreigh is awarded the spare position but to be fair I will leave this thread open for 12 hours from now for any objections.We can then move forward and update the original thread...
